title: The Peculiar Physics Of Wiffle Balls
description: Wiffle Balls are a lightweight alternative to baseballs, better suited for backyards then sports stadiums. The design of the Wiffle Ball guarantees you don't need a strong arm to throw a curve ball. But how does that happen? Engineering professor Jenn Stroud Rossman explains.

itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: The design of the Wiffle Ball guarantees you don't need a strong arm to throw a curve ball. But what physics makes that possible?
